result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina N. Grim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christina N. Grim is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christina N. Grim was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Christina N. Grim was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: [Covers 22CF141 & 22CM287] PP Due Date Summary mailed to Defendant - Attempted - Not Known/Unable to Fwd.
Huber

[ma] Cases 22CF141 & 22CM287 called at 9:32am 
Defendant Christina N. Grim in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Christina N. Grim.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case 22CF141: ADA Teuber moves to amend information, no objection from Atty Nelson, the Court grants request; ADA Teuber submits amended information. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2 and #3 of Case 22CF141 and Charge is Case 22CM287; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Count #1 of Case 22CF141 outright. 

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Grim

As to Case 22CF141, The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60  days jail, each count concurrent to each other with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence.
--60 days credit for time already served given
**THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE**
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $886, Non-payment will result in a 18  day jail term, consecutive.
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

As to Case 22CM287, Initial Appearance and Plea and Sentencing occurs: 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.

As to Case 22CM287,The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve  5 days jail, with Huber, consecutive to any other sentences.
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Ms. Grim is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, Non-payment will result in a  9 day jail term, consecutive.
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

The Court grants installment payments of $25 per month beginning 12/1/22 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full
recess: 10:02am

[ma] Case called at 8:33am 
Defendant Christina N. Grim in court, in custody.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Christina N. Grim.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Deputy Amy Heggie -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson 
--questioning by the Court

The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Grim committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Atty Nelson requests a motion hearing be scheduled for forthcoming bond motion. 

JA to schedule bond motion within week of filing. 
recess: 8:47am

[ml] Case called at 1:25PM
Defendant Christina N. Grim appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD Att Nelson remains appointed). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att De La Rosa affirms that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Att De La Rosa states that the Defendant had transportation issues that prevented her from appearing at the last scheduled hearing.
Parties provide arguments related to bond.

The Court modifies bond, requiring a $500.00 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. 

Att De La Rosa invokes the right to a speedy Preliminary Hearing. The Court sets this matter for a Preliminary Hearing.

recess 1:31PM

--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[ma] Case called at 1:22 PM 
Defendant Christina N. Grim appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take prescription medications only as prescribed

recess 1:25 pm.
